and select their preferred option (rebook or travel fund) through the Manage Booking portal on the CEB website.

Domestic flights will still operate as scheduled, however passengers on these flights who wish to voluntarily postpone their trips until December 31, 2021 may conveniently cancel up to two (2) hours before their scheduled time of departure

As we continue to monitor the situation in our domestic stations and work towards stabilizing our operations, we are extending flexible options for routes touching Puerto Princesa and Cebu until December 31, 2021.

data.text: International arrivals at the Mactan Cebu International Airport have been rescheduled to December 23 starting at 6am. From December 23- 25, only overseas Filipino workers (OFWs) and returning Filipinos who are Cebu residents will be allowed to board the aircraft

#CEBAdvisory - Cebu Pacific Advisory #16

Additional Flight Cancellations and Flexible Options in the Aftermath of Super Typhoon Odete
As of 10:30PM, December 20, 2021

The safety of our passengers and crew in affected areas remains our topmost priority. Thank you for your patience and understanding. 
For other questions or concerns, passengers may send a message via Charlie the chatbot on the Cebu Pacific website.

They may conveniently cancel up to two (2) hours before their scheduled time of departure and select their preferred option through the Manage Booking portal on the CEB website. 
Passengers are advised to refer to the full list of affected flights here: https://t.co/f0i7ZOjlKY

Other domestic flights will still operate as scheduled, however CEB is also offering flexible options (rebook or travel fund) to passengers on select flights who wish to voluntarily postpone their trips from December 20 to 26, 2021.

•5J553 Manila – Cebu: new ETD at 12:30 PM 
•5J554 Cebu – Manila: new ETD at 3:15 PM

CEB has also rescheduled the following flights tomorrow, December 21, 2021: 
•5J606 Cebu – Clark: new ETD at 9:00 AM 
•5J607 Clark – Cebu: new ETD at 11:00 AM 
•DG6571 Cebu – Tacloban: new ETD at 1:50 PM 
•DG6572 Tacloban – Cebu: new ETD at 3:10 PM

Affected passengers have been informed via contact details provided in the booking. They may select their preferred option (rebook, travel fund, or refund) through the Manage Booking portal on the Cebu Pacific website (https://t.co/GAB2WoEUdR) until 30 days from date of departure

Cebu Pacific Advisory #15 
Additional Flight Cancellations in the Aftermath of Super Typhoon Odette 
As of 3:00PM, December 20, 2021 
The Mactan Cebu International Airport has resumed operations but still caters to limited domestic flights. https://t.co/8DiLg6reAU
For other questions or concerns, passengers may send a message via Charlie the chatbot on the Cebu Pacific website.

Passengers are advised to refer to the full list of affected flights here: https://t.co/f0i7ZOBuZ6 

The safety of our passengers and crew in affected areas remains our topmost priority. Thank you for your patience and understanding.
They may conveniently cancel up to two(2) hours before their scheduled time of departure and select their preferred option through the Manage Booking portal on the CEB website.

Other domestic flights will still operate as scheduled, however CEB is also offering flexible options (rebook or travel fund) to passengers on select flights who wish to voluntarily postpone their trips from December 20 to 26, 2021.
They may select their preferred option (rebook, travel fund, or refund) through the Manage Booking portal on the Cebu Pacific website (https://t.co/GAB2WonRbR) until 30 days from date of departure.
Affected passengers have been informed via contact details provided in the booking.

· 5J 559 / 5J 560Manila – Cebu – Manila

· 5J 557 / 5J 556Manila – Cebu – Manila

· 5J 583 Manila –Cebu

· 5J 563 / 5J 564Manila – Cebu – Manila

Given the operational limitations in the aftermath of Super Typhoon Odette (Rai), Cebu Pacific has canceled the following flights on December 20, 2021:

· 5J 576 Cebu –Manila

· 5J 553 Manila –Cebu

· 5J 584 Cebu –Manila

· 5J 551 / 5J 552Manila – Cebu – Manila

Cebu Pacific Advisory #14

Additional Flight Cancellations in the Aftermath of Super Typhoon Odette
As of 10:30PM, December 19, 2021

The Mactan Cebu International Airport has resumed operations but still caters to limited domestic flights.
For other questions or concerns, passengers may send a message via Charlie the chatbot on the Cebu Pacific website.

Passengers are advised to refer to the full list of affected flights here: https://t.co/f0i7ZOjlKY 

The safety of our passengers and crew in affected areas remains our topmost priority. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Affected passengers have been informed via contact details provided in the booking. They may select their preferred option (rebook, travel fund, or refund) through the Manage Booking portal on the Cebu Pacific website (https://t.co/GAB2WoEUdR) until 30 days from date of departure

As such, Cebu Pacific canceled the following flights:

December 30,2021

December 22-31,2021

The Surigao Airport and Siargao Airport have both suspended operations to assess damage brought about by Super Typhoon Odette (Rai) and to make the necessary repairs to ensure safety of operations.

The safety of our passengers and crew in affected areas remains our topmost priority. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Affected passengers have been informed via contact details provided in the booking. They may select their preferred option (rebook, travel fund, or refund) through the Manage Booking portal on the Cebu Pacific website (https://t.co/GAB2WoEUdR) until 30 days from date of departure
Cebu Pacific has also canceled Flight 5J 014 Manila–Dubai on December 20 due to operational limitations.

December 21, 2021

Operations at Puerto Princesa International Airport remain suspended to give authorities enough time to assess damage and to make the necessary repairs to ensure safety of operations.

While the Mactan Cebu International Airport is in the process of restoring regular services after sustaining damage in the aftermath of Super Typhoon Odette, Cebu Pacific has canceled the following flights:   

December 19, 2021

For other questions or concerns, passengers may send a message via Charlie the chatbot on the Cebu Pacific website.

Cebu Pacific is working on mounting recovery flights for the passengers affected by cancellations and will provide updates as soon as possible. The safety of our passengers and crew in affected areas remains our topmost priority. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

3. Refund  

The process may take up to two (2) months from the date of request. 

Passengers are advised to refer to the full list of affected flights here: https://t.co/f0i7ZOjlKY

2. Travel Fund  

Store the amount in a virtual CEB wallet valid for two (2) years and use this to either book a new flight or pay for add-ons (e.g. baggage allowance, seat selection, etc.)

1. Rebook 
Rebook for travel within 60 days at no additional cost, following CEB’s permanent removal of change fees. Fare difference waived.

data.text: For other questions or concerns, passengers may send a message via Charlie the chatbot on the Cebu Pacific website.

Passengers who wish to rebook to above flights may conveniently do so through the Manage Booking portal on the Cebu Pacific website (https://t.co/GAB2WoEUdR). They may also opt to select other options (travel fund or refund) via the same link.

2. Travel Fund  

Store the amount in a virtual CEB wallet valid for two (2) years and use this to either book a new flight or pay for add-ons (e.g. baggage allowance, seat selection, etc.)  

3. Refund  

The process may take up to two (2) months from the date of request.

1. Rebook 

Rebook for travel within 60 days at no additional cost, following CEB’s permanent removal of change fees. Fare difference waived.

Affected passengers have been informed via contact details provided in the booking. They may select their preferred option through the Manage Booking portal on the Cebu Pacific website (https://t.co/GAB2WoEUdR) until 30 days from date of departure:

5J 584 Cebu – Manila 
5J 551 / 5J 558 Manila – Cebu – Manila 
5J 561 / 5J 562 Manila – Cebu – Manila 
DG 6791 / DG 6792 Cebu – Ozamiz – Cebu 
DG 6839 / DG 6840 Manila – Siargao – Manila 
DG 6851 / DG 6840 Cebu – Siargao – Cebu

As such, Cebu Pacific canceled the following flights on December 18 and 19, 2021:

DG 6881 / DG 6882 Manila – Surigao – Manila
